result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sawyer County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher James Voigt

records.addlTxt: Signature Bond Ordered Forfeited on 7/8/2022 - paperwork was not processed, Clerical Error.   Processing paperwork effective today.
Uploaded and processed document to Sharefile, sent paper copy to dispatch, printed warrant card.

11:40 AM Defendant Christopher James Voigt not in court.   Attorney Alysja Otten appeared by video for Christopher James Voigt.  Attorney Jennifer Gross appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Otten stands mute.  State requests warrant and bail forfeiture proceedings.   Court grants request.  Warrant authorized (Wisconsin and Surrounding States) as requested and bail forfeiture to begin.
Bail/Bond Review scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Christopher James Voigt not in court.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Alysja Otten appeared by video for Christopher James Voigt. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attorney Alysja Otten makes statement, DEF posted bond and being transferred to treatment via probation agent.  Discussion followed.  State is not taking position at this time, and requesting validation of funeral.   Court does not address warrant at this time,  Court orders confirmation to be filed on treatment by Wednesday 6/29/2022, if not filed court will address.
Review scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Signature bond $250, with a $250 cash component
Signature bond $250, with a $250 cash component

8:39 AM Defendant Christopher James Voigt appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gabriel Pollak (Special Appearance) in court for Christopher James Voigt.   Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.   DEF indicates to proceed with Attny Pollak.  DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   Court enters NG Plea to Count 2.   DEF indicates to set preliminary hearing within time limits.   Court sets.  Bond Continues.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 27, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: SIGNATURE BOND $250 RETURNED FROM JAIL MARKED REFUSED AS DEFENDANT REFUSED TO SIGN BOND.
CASH BOND $250  RETURNED FROM JAIL MARKED REFUSED AS DEFENDANT REFUSED TO SIGN BOND.

8:40 AM  Defendant Christopher J. L. Voigt  in court, in custody appears by video.  Attny Otten appear in court. Kenneth  Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DEF gave correct spelling of last name VOIGT, incorrect in the PC statement.   State indicates waiting for report, request additional time.    INITIAL APPEARANCE set for June 7, 2022 @ 8:30 AM

11:20 AM Defendant Christopher J. L. Voight in court, in custody appears by video.  Attny Otten  (special appearance) appear in court by video.  Kenneth  Sortedahl appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Probable Cause found by court.  To be determined if DEF qualifies for PD appointment.   State makes bond recommendation.  Attny Otten argues bond.  Court addresses DEF.   Court sets bond.  SIBS $250  with Cash Component $250  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.    INITIAL APPEARANCE set for  May 31, 2022 @ 8:30 AM
